original: Lundh, Atle Nils Fredrik, fd. läroverksadjunkt, Göteborg, f. 26/12/81 i Hjärsås, Krist. 1., av kontr iprosten A. L. N. L. o. Anna Holm. G. 13 m. lär. Ingrid Melin. Barn: Hans Lennart f. 17, fil. lic., Märta 18, skolkökslär., Torsten 22, fil. kand., stud. v. hand:-högsk. i Gbg. — Mog:ex. i Kristianstad 00, teol. fil. ex. i Lund 01, teol. kand. 05. Studires. t. Berlin 06, Mar-burg 07, Tyskl. o. Schweiz m. stats-stip. 21, Tyskl. 27 o. 31. E. o. lektor i ^Skövde 09-15, rektor i Trollhättan 15-20, ord. ämneslär. i Nässjö 20, adj. där 28, rektor 20-31, adj. i kristend:-kunsk. o. modersm. v. Majorna’S h. a. 1. i Gbg 32-47, tillika rektors skriv-bitr. 36-47. Led. av lokalstyr. f. Majornas li. a. 1. 34-47, v. ordf. i Gbgs lär rsällsk. 35-38, i Nässjö bl. a. led. av skolrådet 23-31 o. dess v. ordf. 30-31.
translated: Lundh, Atle Nils Fredrik, former high school teacher, Gothenburg, b. 26/12/81 in Hjärsås, Kristianstad, son of the vicar A. L. N. L. and Anna Holm. Married on the 13th of May to teacher Ingrid Melin. Children: Hans Lennart, born in 1917, licentiate in philosophy, Märta, born in 1918, school kitchen teacher, Torsten, born in 1922, bachelor of philosophy, currently studying at the business college in Gothenburg. Completed exams in Kristianstad in 1900, philosophy exams in Lund in 1901, theology exams in Lund in 1905. Studied in Berlin in 1906, Marburg in 1907, Germany and Switzerland with state scholarships in 1921, Germany in 1927 and 1931. Temporary high school teacher in Skövde from 1909-1915, principal in Trollhättan from 1915-1920, regular subject teacher in Nässjö from 1920, deputy there in 1928, principal from 1920-1931, deputy in religious education and mother tongue at Majorna's high school in Gothenburg from 1932-1947, also assistant to the principal from 1936-1947. Member of the local board for Majorna's municipal district from 1934-1947, deputy chairman of the Gothenburg teachers' association from 1935-1938, in Nässjö among other things, member of the school council from 1923-1931 and its deputy chairman from 1930-1931.
